column4: Every time I try to remove mysql-server-5.1, it tells me "package is in a very bad inconsistent state - you should reiinstll it before attempting a removal". However, any attempt to reinstall it causes the package manager to freeze.
How do I get rid of it? I can't install anything else while it's there
Also, while it's frozen, I have to kill apt-get, then reboot the system to get rid of the lock. Is there an easier way around this?
Oops, closed wrong terminal
So, how do I remove the lock? (Sorry if you've said it already, I closed the irssi terminal by mistake.
sudo apt-get install -f
I can't. It freezes on mysql-server-5.1 normally, and the second time after I've killed one, it just says "could not get lock"
just check if it goes to sleep, how do you kill it ?
Closing the terminal window, then it prompts to kill the process running in the terminal
erm, ps aux | grep apt will give you an insight
Ok, thanks
no problem
is apt still running ? did you check ?
It was. kill <process_id> got rid of it.
check again, to make sure, kill -9 will be better
Yes, it's gone now
run apt-get install -f
Already done, it freezes on "preparing to replace mysql-server-5.1"
then purge it
you can also use Synaptic and use the Broken filter to see what is broken
kk
, and whoever else was helping - it seems to be solved now. Thanks.
no problem, happy to help you :)
